google_reviews.author: Bim S
google_reviews.review: Really great apartments located in a central area! Very close to fairhaven, downtown bellingham, and i5. There's a trail right behind the apartment, so the views are great when everything is in bloom. PCR is currently the property management company and they are very kind, responsive, and do a great job.

summary.text:
Good

In this article, the good aspects of Voltaire Court Apartments highlight its favorable location and pleasant surroundings. Situated centrally, the apartments offer convenient access to Fairhaven, downtown Bellingham, and the I-5, making it ideal for residents who appreciate being near urban amenities. Additionally, a trail behind the building provides scenic views, especially during the blooming season, offering residents a natural retreat right at their doorstep.

Great

The user reviews consistently emphasize the excellent management provided by PCR, the current property management company. Residents have found the management team to be kind, responsive, and efficient in handling their responsibilities, exemplifying exceptional service. This consistency in high-quality management sets Voltaire Court Apartments apart, ensuring tenant satisfaction and contributing to the overall positive experience of living there.

Bad

At this time, there are no user reviews highlighting any significant negative aspects or bad experiences at Voltaire Court Apartments. The singular review available paints a picture of satisfaction and contentment among the tenants, indicating that potential issues are either minimal or effectively managed by the property team.

Ugly

Similarly, the user reviews do not report any disturbing or ugly experiences associated with Voltaire Court Apartments. The lack of negative feedback or troubling incidents suggests that the property maintains a good standard of living for its residents. In conclusion, the absence of ugly reviews further reinforces the apartment’s reputation as a well-managed and pleasing place to live, as inferred from current data.
